{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3555729,"name":"Myer","username":"myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T01:35:26.093Z","cooked":"

We are using two Limelights on the left and right sides of our robot to align to either the left or the right of the reef. If we want the left side of the reef, we align with the right camera straight on to the AprilTag and vice versa.

This approach somewhat works, but it is quite janky and is not very consistent sometimes. This seems unavoidable since we are using one single AprilTag and the numbers we are reading are pretty jumpy too.

Here is the code: REEFSCAPE-2025/src/main/java/frc/robot/commands/AlignToReef.java at 0c4bc58f4de207652cd3b9d7ae4b3abd80d31f92 · RambotsTeam1350/REEFSCAPE-2025 · GitHub

One thing we ran into is that the camera loses vision of the AprilTag pretty commonly, especially because the command tries to rotate the bot to be parallel with the reef, which means if the bot is too far away, it won’t be facing the tag anymore. Is there any way I could incorporate the tx measurement into my current code to alleviate this?

Any other suggestions or comments about how to improve the code are also appreciated!
